thread.title: Spoiled Relations: U.S. Goods Stuck at China Ports as Tensions Heat Up

author: Lucy Craymer
title: Spoiled Relations: U.S. Goods Stuck at China Ports as Tensions Heat Up
text:
Ford cars and California fruits are among the goods piling up at Chinese ports, the result of increased inspections that business groups say is Chinaâ€™s way of reminding the U.S. how important its market is to American exporters.
Navel oranges, lemons and cherries from California, along with American apples, have been sitting at Chinese wharves for longer than normal as Chinese inspectors spend more time inspecting the fruits for pests and decays, U.S. trade groups said.
... RELATED VIDEO U.S.-China Trade Tensions: What Business Leaders Say With increasing trade tensions between China and the U.S., top executives at the Wall Street Journal D.Live conference talk about how that will affect business.
